newsitem.title: SWITZERLAND: SOCCER-QUESTION MARK OVER BAKERI'S SEVEN-GOAL WORLD CUP RECORD.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-QUESTION MARK OVER BAKERI'S SEVEN-GOAL WORLD CUP RECORD.

text.p: FIFA said on Tuesday that Iranian
striker Karim Bakeri's seven-goal World Cup spree on Monday
could not yet be recognised as a world record.
Iran went into the World Cup record books with their 17-0
demolition of the Maldive Islands in an Asian zone qualifier in
Damascus on Monday, beating the previous best of 13-0, set by
New Zealand against Fiji in 1981.
Bakeri scored seven of them, three in a five-minute spell
between the 11th and 16th minutes, followed by an almost equally
fast six-minute hat-trick between the 62nd and 68th minutes
before completing his tally five minutes from time.
There is currently no record of any player scoring as many
as seven goals in a World Cup match but FIFA said details of
early qualifiers were still incomplete and that it was too early
to recognise Bakeri's mark as a world record.
Iran's win marked only the 14th time in World Cup history
where one team has scored at least 10 goals. Apart from
Hungary's 10-1 win over El Salvador in the 1982 finals in Spain,
all were in qualifiers.
Four of them have been in qualifiers for next year's World
Cup finals in France.
The 14 are as follows (year denotes year of World Cup finals
for which match was played):
Score Year
Iran v Maldive Islands 17-0 1998
New Zealand v Fiji 13-0 1982
West Germany v Cyprus 12-0 1970
Honduras v St Vincent 11-3 1998
Liechtenstein v Macedonia 1-11 1998
Trinidad v Antigua 11-1 1974
Hungary v Greece 11-1 1938
Mexico v St Vincent 11-0 1994
Japan v Macao 10-0 1998
Norway v San Marino 10-0 1994
Australia v Fiji 10-0 1982
Finland v Soviet Union 0-10 1958
Macao v Kuwait 1-10 1994
Hungary v El Salvador 10-1 1982
